Activity: Log in to the EHR system and check for any new updates or notifications. Review hospital-wide announcements regarding EHR implementation progress.
Review the EHR data entry guidelines and protocols, focusing on required fields for patient assessment.
Prepare my workstation with necessary supplies for patient assessments (e.g., stethoscope, thermometer, blood pressure cuff, alcohol wipes).
Begin patient assessments: Patient 1 - Vitals, medical history review, medication reconciliation. Accurately record all information directly into the EHR.
Patient Assessments: Patient 2 - Vitals, medical history review, medication reconciliation. Accurately record all information directly into the EHR.
Review EHR documentation with @ClinLead-1, specifically focusing on any areas where data entry completeness could be improved.
Continue patient assessments: Patient 3 - Vitals, medical history review, medication reconciliation. Address patient concerns and record everything in the EHR.
Patient Assessments: Patient 4 - Vitals, medical history review, medication reconciliation. Address patient concerns and record everything in the EHR.
Prepare influenza vaccination station: gather vaccines, syringes, alcohol wipes, bandages, and sharps container. Confirm vaccine expiration dates.
Administer influenza vaccination to Patient 5 and accurately document the date, time, vaccine lot number, and injection site in the EHR.
Document any adverse reactions of vaccines of the day in the EHR. Ensure proper disposal of used syringes and other materials.
Review all EHR entries from the day to ensure accuracy and completeness. Flag any discrepancies for follow-up.
Email @Helpdesk-1 and @ITPM-1 to report an issue I found when entering patient allergy details; include screenshots and steps to replicate.
Log out of the EHR system and end work.
